constraints: Completeness ("narrow"): The response restricts the discussion to a very small slice of the topic, avoiding broad context.

Form ("cards"): The response organizes ideas as discrete cards or items, each with a clear heading and short body, avoiding long continuous prose.
Channel ("plain"): The response uses plain prose with natural paragraphs and sentences as the delivery format, imposing no additional structural conventions such as bullets, tables, or code blocks.
Directional ("ong"): The response modifies the task to identify concrete actions to take, then extends those actions to related situations or next steps.
